WRITING.TITLE: Help me start my journey today
WRITING.TEXT: I know Christmas and New Year are round the corner but if I don't start now that means I'll put on another 4kg and hate myself even more. There really is no time like the present to start. It's summer here. I don't want to be in summer clothes. I put on weight gradually as an autoimmune disorder stopped my exercise then a miscarriage caused depression and over eating. Then pregnancy. Then post pregnancy which was way worse than pregnancy for me over indulging due to stress and tiredness. So now I'm 5ft3in. I'm 62kg. I hate my body. I drink too much and then next-day I eat crap. I should stick to 1200 Cals. I don't. I'm living with family where drinking and take aways are common so it's even harder. Help me with some motivation and tips please! I've lurked a while and feeling reassured there are no trolls Im here to seek some encouragement I occasionally do 16:8 but often lapse (normally when booze involved). I am mostly vegan. I try to do the Kayla sweat workouts when can and run 5k once a week. Thank you!
That's a really good point. I do need to track. I think I've done well to maintain but I won't lose if I'm not honest with myself. Thank you for the encouragement. How are you doing on your journey?

Thanks for the tips I thought the vegan angle would make it easier but it seems every takeaway does a vegan option these days giving me little excuse. It's just they're unhealthy options!!!! I really appreciate the response. I hope to post in 2 weeks at least with no gain!

Yes me too. I've realised nothing positive comes from me drinking. And in fact even if the night itself is ok it leaves me with anxiety and depression the day after. I'm trying to stop and finding I can't and that's scaring me. So I came here to see some tips. It's been 3 days since you posted. I hope it's going well.
Good luck. I'm on day 1. I know what a time to pick just before NYE! And it's hard so I'm here for inspiration and motivation and you did that! So thank you

WRITING.TITLE: Day 1
WRITING.TEXT: What a day to start. The day before NYE. But yeah why not. Another poster said that most unfortunate or unhappy things and nights that happen to them occur when drunk. That is true for me too. I think I remember a time drinking led to fun nights. It's been a long time since that happened though. Now it's just guilt and fear and anxiety. So I drink again and continue the cycle. I've a young son who needs to not have a mum who relies on wine and feels anxious because of it. I've stopped for days at a time. Feel great. Drink and think I can handle it now and then but it always turns into regular drinking again. So I know I need to quit for good or at least months / years to make a change. I am currently on holiday with the family. All of whom drink a lot, daily and encourage drinking. May be a mistake but I'm not going to tell them I'm stopping. Because I know they'd tell me I worry too much to just cut down etc. And I don't need to hear that. What I need to hear are the stories here. About how better life is without booze for those with an issue. And I'm scared of a sober NYE around drunk people. But I'm just trying to visualise a hangover guilt free NYD and a positive start to 2019. So I may use this space as a bit of an occasional diary. I'm doing this now because the urge to drink has been huge and I thought if I wrote down my feelings it would pass. And I think it has helped! Good luck to you all, especially with the silly night approaching!

Gosh thank you for the support. I'm in bed. I did it! My first day alcohol free. And I feel really positive. I had bouts of anxiety but I know that's the overhang from weeks of drinking and If I keep going it will pass as I grow in real confidence not fake alcohol induced confidence. I will take it one day at a time. But at least I'm going to bed feeling excited about what I've achieved and wanting to do it again tomorrow instead of feeling as if I've missed out in some way.
I'm glad to hear it's been positive for you so far. I'm sorry you had an awful night. Alcohol is indeed the enemy and you're taking some control which is really positive

WRITING.TITLE: Day 2
WRITING.TEXT: I won't post every day! But it's new years Eve here and I'm so proud. I love champagne and I said no. And I feel fine about it. I've definitely eaten more junk food today in compensation but that's fine. My eating junk food never led to me being an ass to someone. It's a little lonely. I can't be bothered to sit outside in the chilly air. I find it hard to socialise without booze (am an introvert). But I'm happy with myself so I'm accepting the quiet time for now. Good luck for NYE everyone
I love this!

God you sound like me. I'm two weeks tomorrow and so tempted to have a glass or two. I reckon it would be nice at the time. But it'll start to be one or two a night again and then my anxiety racks up. Good luck with!
Science. All science. Things fascinate me and then people try and explain the "science" behind it and I just get a headache

WRITING.TITLE: Keep lapsing
WRITING.TEXT: I really do want to stop. I see alcohol as a toxic drug. I'm addicted. I've not had a good drunk night in years as I get blind drunk and make an idiot of myself and put myself in harm's way push away those I'm close to. You know the score. Anyhow I stopped. I really thought i had. Got to 5 days had a couple. Did not get drunk. Stopped two weeks. Had a couple two nights in a row. Stopped. Had three nights off then had one tonight. Everyone else is continuing drinking I've gone to bed. I'm so cross I had one. My husband says don't worry it's just one. But it's where it begins. I've started to think of it like smoking. If I'd just had one cigarette he'd be horrified at the harm and risk. Why don't people see booze like that? And I'm living with people currently who love a drink. I think I've stopped the getting drunk bit. Or I have for now I know one here or there will eventually lead to old habits even if I'm keeping it to one for now. Any tips on how I stop the one drink here and there as I really want zero alcohol in my system.

gt;There have been great posts on SD in the past about the "fuck its," and what that actually means. When you say "fuck it," you're talking about your life, your health, your happiness, your relationships, your hopes, your dreams. Fuck it? No thanks, I'll keep trying. I am so glad you will as well. I just posted about relapses too. I'm very sadly to say two weeks is most I've got to and I'm seeking advice. Then saw this post and this reply and OP and you have both given me hope. Thank you!
I used to get so sick the next day and the anxiety would rage until I had another drink. Such an awful loop. Good luck with today
I'm trying to quit for good but lots of people around me don't see the problem and that's making it really hard

Honestly I don't know. Habit maybe. Feeling like I'm joining in. I live with my husband and in laws and they all like a drink. A lot. And so I can't get away from it. Im not even enjoying it when I do have a glass as I feel I'm letting myself down and know it's no good for me.
If I look at my overall sober days to non since new year it's better than not trying as I'd have drunk every day. So I will keep trying!

That's a good idea. As probably I'm feeling insecure or left out or a bit down and alcohol actually causes all of those feelings to become heightened in me so if I think about it I can maybe logic my way through!
Best of luck. Let us know how you go
Congratulations!!!!! It's an amazing achievement

The more serious the allegation the more cogent the evidence has to be. It is a most serious allegation that a parent murdered or caused the death of their child, staged an abduction, and disposed of their body. So there should be some cogent evidence to support that. The 3 things you've listed are so far from that as to be effectively useless. Who knows what any of is would do on discovering a child has gone missing. I'd like to think of grab the twins too. But In a split second she chose to run and scream for help. Evidence she did??!! God if that were evidence we should all be very scared. The dogs. Well I don't know enough but I believe they smell blood or death. In a rental car and appartment. Where hundreds of people have stayed. Does it prove the body or blood of Maddy was there? Nope. And certainly would lead to more questions of how they hid and moved a body with the world watching and apparently a suspicious police force. The twins sleeping. Yep well babies can be surprisingly excellent sleepers. And if people were coming and going and they were still asleep then there are more people than the parents who can attest to that. And checking on their breathing??!! Every parent does that. My boy is nearly 2 and every time I check on him whilst he's asleep I look to see he's breathing!! Not evidence I'm afraid. I really just think that a nasty conspiracy theory has been put out there and now people are trying to bend evidence to fit that. you have to look at the evidence and where it leads you not the other way around. And really none of the three things you've mentioned, If for you it is just those 3 things, can seriously lead a sane person to conclude that therefore these otherwise good parents murdered or caused the death of their child, covered it up, hid the body, buried it somewhere no one has ever found it, and have carried on the charade for years perhaps even roping in some friends along the way. Because of how she reacted in the first seconds of discovery? And because a dog smelled blood but can't tell us whose blood or when it was left there...

Ha thanks. I put it out there in the hope it may make some people think more critically. It's seriously depressing to see how many people are willing to think the parents did this awful thing with literally no evidence supporting the theory.

Many people could have hidden the body sure But that's my point. How many people do we need to believe would be cold blooded enough to cover up the death of a child to pull off this theory? No of course no one was under lock and key. But the McCanns weren't alone for any period of time. I remember watching this all unfold and the hundreds of press being camped outside where they were staying photographing and videoing them whenever they stepped outside. They were interviewed by press by police by British officials. So much was going on. I honestly can't see how anyone could sneak a dead body out into a rental car and hide it so well with no one noticing. What's the point in considering hypothetical??!! There was no blood found.....

WRITING.TITLE: Day 1 5:2
WRITING.TEXT: So here it goes. Today weighed in at 62.3kg Short story is used to be size 12-14 at 5ft 2in since a teenager. Found myself in my late 20s and managed to sustain a size 8 through exercise and healthy eating and it felt easy. Lost myself after miscarriage and then successful pregnancy and breastfeeding and sleep deprivation. Son is now nearly 2 and it's time to stop kidding myself. The baby weight was put on by overeating and has stayed on by overeating. I'd guess I easily consume 1600 a day on a good day and 2500 on a bad day. Taking that into account it's a miracle I've stayed the same 61-63kg for the past 12 months! But truth is I'm not happy or comfortable in my weight now. I'm a size 12 and would like to be a slim size 10 (fairly sure the size 8s are behind me now I'm 37). I want to be fit again too. So I'm signing up for the tough mudder and 10k runs to have a fitness goal. And I'm doing 5-2. Today was my first day. It was surprisingly not as hard as I thought it would be. It wasn't easy either! I had no breakfast or lunch (just some soya milk in tea) and some dinner to come in at under 500cals. I'm posting I guess to prove to myself its time to commit. I've lurked for a while. Every single one of you who has posted inspires me. I hope to inspire people too over the coming weeks and months. Live happily and healthily good people of Reddit!
Thanks all! Gotta say I'm lookin forward to my breakfast this morning!!

My second fast day. It's tougher today but I've stuck with it. Just need to make sure I don't over compensate tomorrow and have more calories than my TDEE I really want to have a perfect week so I can be sure this will work as it may make it easier to stick to going forward

WRITING.TITLE: What do I need to be aware of next?
WRITING.TEXT: I've successfully completed my first week and a couple of challenges where I'd normally drink and didn't. I feel elated. But I know this isn't it. I haven't cracked it. So I'm aware that thinking I'm ok now is a false narrative. What other tricks will my brain play and what can i.do to prepare? All the evidence is now suggesting no amount of alcohol is safe. Zero. Every drink worsens our health out comes. The links to cancer are now being evidenced. I do not come on this site to scare people for what it's worth. But seeing as you specifically asked and cancer is a big fear of mine I thought I'd share info from a reputal site. https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/alcohol-and-cancer/does-alcohol-cause-cancer#targetText=Drinking%20alcohol%20increases%20the%20risk,damage%20all%20around%20the%20body.

I've recently moved to Australia from UK and I really like the health system here. I think the extr ass top ups by people help make the system better too. GP appointments same day, and absolutely excellent healthcare. I saw one GP here who is also from UK. I rushed through telling her what I needed (a repeat prescription) and she chatted and asked questions. I got my script and started to leave and she said "where are you going" I was like I've had my 10 mins so don't want to keep you. She understood because it reminded her of how under pressure UK GPs are And she said no lets talk some more I think I should refer to a couple of specialists for these things you've been taking meds for for years to check it all out. I was blown away!
Congratulations! An amazing achievement IWNDWYT #12days
12 days today. In bed in Aus. Looking forward to completing week 2 and feeling stronger every day
Thats a really refreshing and honest statement. Thank you
I also now want to test
Yay it worked! Well done guys

WRITING.TITLE: The wobbles start
WRITING.TEXT: Beautiful evening. Friday night. Someone suggests a drink. For a fleeting moment I think it's been 13 days. Just for a moment. No. It isn't worth it. It won't be one drink. I'm doing the "and then" exercise I read on here before. One drink. And then A second drink. And then Come home and open a bottle. And then I put my child to bed and kiss him goodnight with alcohol on my breathe. And then I have more drink. By now I'm drunk. I start to get argumentative and don't make much sense. And then I go to bed annoyed with myself and the world. And then I have an even worse nights sleep than the sober insomnia I'm currently going through. And then Tomorrow I hate myself. I have increased anxiety and depression. I don't want to see anyone. Wow. Yeah that's convinced me. Not even one. IWNDWYT
Romanticize is such an accurate word for how it appears in my brain too!
Well done! That takes some willpower!
I can say last night I slept for the first time in 13 nights. I hope it happens for you soon too!

Missing the numbing right now. But I won't miss feeling anxious tomorrow. As awful as I'm feeling right now at least I can look at those feelings with a sober lens and not an anxiety anger induced one
That's lovely. I'm so happy for.you and your son #9786; #65039;

I wish you the very best of luck! Noticing the negatives really helped me. As I play it through my mind when I'm tempted. One thing constantly happening to me the last few months of drinking was a scalloped tongue. It hurt so bad I thought I had tongue cancer. It got to a stage where I just thought I don't want that. Maybe you'll feel that way next time you're tempted too with the heartburn and stuff.

WRITING.TITLE: Stage 2
WRITING.TEXT: I've survived the first two weeks. Something I haven't achieved in a while. I've done it with a lot of support from here and discipline. And the support of my husband. I'm feeling unwell and it may be partly anxiety driven. Almost certainly is actually. So now it's on to stage 2 so I can beat the anxiety and not let it convince me drinking is an answer or the answer. I've downloaded a meditation app. I'll restart calorie counting and exercise. Fitting these things in should now be easier without booze throwing me off. I've let myself go for the past 2 weeks to ease some of the feeling of missing out but now I want to start feeling the more positive benefits of this sober life. IWNDWYT

Moderation is such a lie to tell ourselves. Everyday I have to say to myself no. I stopped for two weeks at the turn of the new year and then tried to moderate thinking I had cracked it. It's September and have only just gotten to two weeks again.

Drinking crept in again with my baby. Mainly because you're stuck in the house so instead of going out for drinks it was have a bottle in. Then two or whatever. And it's a grown up time when youve been on own with your baby all day. So you're VERY wise to be alive to the possibility of drinking creeping back in. And people will say yay you can have a drink to celebrate now. You can have one whilst breastfeeding etc. It happens. Lots of mum's groups in my areas met for pub lunches. I think be as prepared as you can by reading books as recommended and discussing your decision with SO.
Yes I'm stuck. My son is 2 when will I actually realise this is no longer 'baby weight but actual weight I need to actively diet to lose!

At my high school in UK we had a deaf unit and hearing impaired students attended regular classes with us. They either could lip read or had a support staff to sign. And we could all go do signing lessons too. I only remember the basics now but this may just inspire me to learn more. They also teach Auslan at my son's nursery so would be cool to learn alongside him.
Seedlip if available with tonic water
I prefer the garden.

Sorry couldn't figure out how to post image and text! Haha. This first happened 4 years ago. I had a coupke.of spinal injection s then. They hurt but I guess it helped. The doc said it's my choice whether to have a spinal injection. It.may help. I'm not in agony any more but my movement is limited and I can't pick my son up and stuff. I tried tramadol and the pain went but I thought I was dying from the sickness and dizziness. An injection would help get me.over the worst right and enable me to start physio? I just don't even know where to start with the pros and cons here so any wisdom appreciated!

I want it dealt with but the GP didn't seem to think surgery was necessary and it was just something to live with.

I absolutely could not have been pushed into stopping and I can't stop him. Hell get there in his own time. I just have to learn not to be tempted by his drinking and just see it as one of those many occasions when people will drink around me and I have to be strong.

WRITING.TEXT: And it didn't even occur to me to drink. Usually I would absolutely drink and even if I decided not to I'd be thinking about drinking. WRITING.TITLE: Surgery yay or nay
WRITING.TEXT: I'm curious.... most of my reading suggests surgery has only marginally better results than conservative measures. But anecdotally I've read a few comments on here and other forums which are really pro surgery. I know everyone is different but can people share their own experiences? Specifically has anyone struggled for years and then had surgery? Did it help in the end? I'm in a pickle because whilst I can live with it I don't want to live with it. I want to run again. I want to be able to pick up my son when he asks. I want to do my aerobics and weights classes. For the past 4 years every time I try and get back into fitness I fail because of my damn back and whilst it's fine most often if I don't do these things, I want to do these things! I'm only 37 I don't feel aerobic exercise should be beyond me. And yes I know swimming is an option.... I just don't like it very much! If it's relevant it a a herniated l5-s1. All the other discs seem a-ok and my health is otherwise good.
Good luck with your recovery! Do update us with how you go.
Thanks all. It's such a scary prospect. Love a modified life possibly forever or take a risk but maybe get healed. What a choice.
It does get better and then you'll have amazing sleeps. Hang in there.

Has his behaviour this past week triggered you because of the way he behaved towards you before? Was he controlling and undermining towards you previously? Could it be helpful to speak to someone about his behaviour and the impact on you? Unfortunately you'll probably have to deal with him as he's the father but there may be ways you can feel stronger. It's not your fault. He Sounds like a bully.

Thanks for the response. I'm trying to work out of I've pushed myself but I don't think so. I've decided to do some clinical Pilates for 12 weeks and some swimming and see how that goes in terms of pain relief and recovery so hopefully that's a good start

The thing that scares me most about falling off the wagon isn't the one bad experience but that I won't be able to stop again.

WRITING.TITLE: Maybe dumb question re spinal injection
WRITING.TEXT: I had them 4 years ago when I first did this and I was in significant pain then. This time round the pain is slowly easing. I can move around but it hurts to sit for pronged periods. Can't lift anything heavy including my son. My big hurts. The more I do the more pins and needles I get in foot and my butt cheek. Not pain but sensations that I shouldn't be feeling. Currently as I lay in bed burning feeling in the hip. Should I still have the injection? I figure the steroid will help these remaining symptoms clear up and enable me to get started on the clinical Pilates I've been recommended to try. But not sure if it's not really suitable when I'm no longer in agony. I've had to stop taking oral anti inflammatory as I was getting bad stomach cramps and headaches Not sure what to do.
Good luck!!!

So I guess reflecting as much as you can and being prepared for the cravings to come back in force and having a plan

Hopefully it'll sink in soon

A fellow shorty beating myself up for 1550 calories today. I try to stick to 1200 and am hungry and at a weekend go crazy as I can't stick it. And what I recently discovered when I forced myself to log every little thing I had on a bad day was I blew calories out of the water. I easily ate the 3500 calories I may have saved in the week. So I figure if I stick to 1600 a day EVERY DAY I'll.probably be better off. So my current aim is between 1200 and 1600 daily as I think I'll still be in a calorie deficit and will have a slow loss. Which is fine. I've been the same weight since giving birth (after initial loss) so I'll take a gradual loss over no loss at this stage!
Depends on what you eat. My tdee is around 1500. If I ate a 2000 cal pizza for dinner and nothing else I wouldn't lose weight

WRITING.TITLE: Confused - chicken or egg scenario
WRITING.TEXT: Really brief but will give more detail if needed. But I think sufferers will know what I mean. I had bad pack pain starting 4 years ago and episodes of memorable pain 2 years ago 6 months ago and 1 month ago. Since the 4 years ago one I've had almost constant weak left leg and an ineffective glute muscle. I say almost constant I'll get weeks of being normal where theeg works and i can do stuff again. Then i cant. Probably i overdo it but when the leg isnt weak nothing in my body says im pushing it. The back pain episodes often start with leg and knee pain before a couple of hours later the back is agony. In between back being agony as I say my left leg is weak and my it band tight as hell. If I release the tightness my back hurts again. When the back is bad I also have numb big toe tight feeling around the ankle shin pain and my butt aches. MRI show bulge l5-s1 scan previously posted. So my question....... How can you tell if it's the weak leg causing the back pain. Or the disc causing the weak leg? Several physio insist if they can get my glute firing again all Will be well. But I feel I can get my glute firing until something interrupts it again. Like I don't feel the glute is just weak and needs strength I feel.something is stopping it.
Oh not so brief once i got started

I always thought he was guilty. I remember debating it with people at the time and couldn't believe they didn't. Maybe because I'm legally trained but I just smelled bs from the off. From memory my thoughts were You don't forget details from the day your ex girlfriend went missing and the police called you. You don't lend your car and new mobile to a sort of acquaintance let alone a friend as a teenager. You don't not try and contact your ex girlfriend when they are first missing to see if maybe she has run away and will trust you with where she is. Adnan and Jay are totally linked on the day in question and Jay was lying to cover his butt and mimimise his involvement so he got off with a lighter sentence. Adnan had motive and seemingly created an opportunity asking for a lift home and involving Jay And then added to all these things the phone records and other bits it looked to me like he was guilty. I also remember wondering was that enough to covinct beyond reasonable doubt? Well the jurors thought so and they heard all the evidence and saw the witnesses demeanour and decided yes it was. Now of course lots of documents have been released and the court has had a lot of opportunity to look at it and uphold guilt. U/Justwonderinif has done great work getting all the docs released.

I think they're all circumstantial so dont prove anything and means you can get carried away with the narrative they want you to believe. But added altogether and oh so many things I'll have forgotten it just felt wrong. And as many have said must be a hell of lot of unlucky coincidences for Adnan to be innocent but look so guilty
My mum died when I was 10. This sun's it up for me

My plan is to start the day right with a swim. And then take my son out for a fun play date. In the afternoon I'll pack away the laundry that's been sat there for a week and I'll finish my job application. I will eat healthily in the evening. A home cooked meal not take away. I will not drink. I will meditate and I will remain positive. I will go to bed pleased with all I've achieved and gained. The alternative is to eat junk food drink alcohol and achieve nothing positive. Start the day right.

WRITING.TITLE: Book recommendations for the toddler years please!
WRITING.TEXT: Hi I'm a parent to a beautiful 27 month old. And I'm falling into the trap of doing all the things I shouldn't be doing. I'm losing my temper, giving in to tantrums, and running out of ideas on how to be a better parent. I've always found ready a good, practical book a good start in doing things better. Any recommendations? There are so many! A summary of some of the problems: - won't brush his teeth properly or let me do it - asking for the toilet 4/5 times after going to bed as a pretense to get up - screaming and crying if I don't lay on his floor when he goes to bed. Taking an hour of crying and me going in and out to settle. If i do stay still not sleeping but making demands like blanket no blanket lullabies no lullabies water no water..... - deliberately throwing things he shouldn't throw - touching things he shouldn't touch (currently the Xmas tree) This makes him sound naughty. He isnt. Hes wonderfully loving and clever and independent and I know all of these things are normal behaviour and him growing and expressing he just wants me with him at night as well as wanting independence. But equally he needs help learning to settle to sleep and manage emotions and demands. So yeah- hit me with any resources that helped you!

Thanks so much! And see that's where I need help is even distinguishing between naughty and normal. And what he should and shouldn't be doing at this age. Thanks for the recommendations and the supportive comments :-)
Thank you! Will check it out. Sounds apt. I love him but am struggling with 2 year old.logic !

Thank you. I know that and know if I call in sick I'm saving it up for Tuesday. I also think if the person is really super annoyed still there isn't much I can do. So actually not the worst thing ive done when drunk but also the big reason I want booze to stop. Sigh. Im trying to find a group.locally. Not AA. I thought there were some Buddhist run groups but can't find it now. I've found an onlne SMART group to join tomorrow night.
Putting things in water like slices of orange or cucumber etc

WRITING.TITLE: Just keep going
WRITING.TEXT: I got to 1 month about 4 months ago maybe. I forget. I thought I was good. I was not. I haven't got to a week since that time. Familiar story on here but adding my name to it. If you think you've beaten it - you haven't. If you have just 1 and manage to stop and think you've beaten it - you haven't. Before you know it it's become a problem again. After way too much Friday I'm only just now recovering my mind and my mental health to be able to face the world and write this again. And I'm scared it won't yet be my time to stop for the last time with Christmas coming up. But I wanted to write this as if I can help one person who is thinking maybe, just maybe, they can enjoy just one...... IWNDWYT

Hey. Day 3 sucks. Hang in there. Day 5 feels a bit better and day 7 so much better. And you won't be alone at Christmas. You'll be messaging us supporting each other not to drink. If you can't do the festivities (and I get it) plan something you will enjoy. Pizza and movie. Xbox. Bath and a book. I promise you'll enjoy it. I've stopped and started many times this year. But my biggest win was not drinking last new years eve. It was amazing. Yes I was in bed before midnight but I woke happy and fresh and went for a run whilst all around me were hungover and didn't remember much. I have never regretted not drinking. I hope you're ok. IWNDWYT

WRITING.TITLE: How are we all feeling about Xmas and New year?
WRITING.TEXT: Any tips and tricks to help me get through. I'm back on day 8 and I don't want Xmas to be the excuse to relapse but feel I need some plan or coping mechanism. My father in laws house is booze central. No one eats breakfast it starts with champagne. Then egg nog. Then aged wine for lunch. Then more wine and more wine. Until the brandy comes out. You get the picture. New year is similar. I think I can do it. Right now my resolve is high. But I am worried as I start to relax for the holidays...... So I thought maybe we could all share some tips and tricks. I've found some non alcoholic cocktail recipes to try so I've always got a yummy drink to try.

Thanks all. Unfortunately not going isn't an option. We stay for a week as family are put in the country so not going means hubby and son don't see any family at Xmas which isn't fair on them. Iys so true that once people are drunk the appeal lessens for me even in these early stages. So I guess the danger times are the first hour or two before everyone starts to show drunkenness. So I'll take time out if needed have yummy snacks and excuse myself for an hour or two. I will definitely try and focus on cooking and maybe I can take the kids all to the park or something during those danger hours.

Well done for getting sober at Xmas. It's hard but I don't want it to be my excuse so I'm going to try. Unfortunately abesenting myself would be difficult as we stay for a week and without going we won't see family for Xmas. My sober app just told me this The first step towards success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself I think it will be a mantra. Yes I'm there yes there is booze but I am.not a captive of it.
That's definitely going to sustain me Xmas eve. I don't want to wake Xmas day hungover and ruin it for my little boy. That's great that boxing day is going to be a bit less boozy this year

WRITING.TITLE: Talking to my 15 year old sister In law about alcohol
WRITING.TEXT: It was enlightening and depressing at the same time. She's started trying drinks and has been drunk at least once I know of. Her parents both drink a lot as do all of us around her. I just spoke with her honestly about it. I told her I wish I'd never started. I told her it's not really led anywhere good. Sure there have been some "fun" nights but when you look back there's been many more bad nights, hangovers and consequences which far outweigh the fun. And that's for everyone who thinks they handle alcohol well because even they get hangovers low productivity and harm their bodies. I told her you wouldn't smoke as it's dangerous and addictive. Alcohol is the same save it's not yet spoken of that way in society. She acknowledged it all. She's seen the harm it does to her parents. But said it's hard as all her friends drink and it's basically down to peer pressure. A lot of FOMO going on. I told her about this forum and all the younger folk on here already making a positive decision to stop at aged 18 onwards and that stats show lots of teenagers aren't drinking now and she could be one of those. I felt for her and I remember exactly what it was like. Planning weekends by who could sneak the alcohol and drinking and feeling grown up. If only they could understand where it could lead. Anyway I told her I'm trying to stop and I'm hoping it will strengthen my resolution not to drink over Christmas to be an example to her of fun without alcohol. And in fact be more fun than all those getting drunk around us!

Ha thanks. I didn't want to lecture her or tell her not to experiment because it is her journey but I thought there was no harm in being honest about where I am right now. And I was honest and said you know I may slip up and drink over Christmas. And that's ok and that's the addiction. But I'd like to stop.

WRITING.TITLE: Hanging in there
WRITING.TEXT: So getting into the family Christmas and so far I've resisted. I'm quite proud of myself. There is a lot of booze around and I'm having water, tea and two fake beers. Last night was tough. I had strong cravings but resisted. And when I smelt my husband's alcohol breath in the middle of the night (Sorry darling I love you) my first thought was thank goodness I didn't drink as that smell reminded me of how alcohol feels to me. Not that smell when it's a fresh poured glass of wine but that smell when it's metabolising and you're dehydrated and have a headache and anxiety and are dreading the morning. So I feel confident I can go a couple more days and the next challenge is Christmas day itself. IWNDWYT

WRITING.TEXT: Usually my back pain ( from degenerated and mild herniated disc l5-s1) causes left glute weakness and pain down back of leg I.e. sciatica. When I was 8 I was cycling down a country road in Essex to return to a farm. My 18 year old cousin was a bit behind me walking our old shared horse. I went ahead being a kid wanting to go faster. A car drove by me and around a couple of bends it was pulled into a layby with the man stood out of the car. He stopped me and asked me if I knew anything about engines. I stopped and said i didn't. He sort of sighed and rubbed his chin looking about as if he didnt know what to do. He took his shirt off and then his trousers and stood there entirely naked acting normal and just distressed about his car. I froze. Then I think he heard the horses hooves. He took a step towards me and I sped off and screamed at him to f off. He chucked his clothes in the car jumped in and sped off past me just as I was turning left into the farm. My mum pulled into the farm moments later (maybe actually he heard her car?) And I was crying and shaking. Even at 8 i knew it was bad but only as an adult did I realise the full extent. As an adult i read a criminology book and it described the crimes of Robert black. He is reported to have said to one of his attempted victims do you know about engines pretending his car had broken down. I had chills reading it and horrid flash backs. I was on a tube at a time. I reached out to the author who confirmed black was a driver in the south east area at the time. This was about 8 months before his arrest. I'll never know if it was him or a coincidence but that's my almost kidnapped story

WRITING.TITLE: You will never regret not drinking
WRITING.TEXT: I'm not doing great in iso. I've managed 7 days off max. Haven't reset my counter so ignore that! But anyway last night at the shops I thought about getting the wine. Just "in case". But that was a trick. The in case meant of course i would drink. So I just didn't get the wine. Then I couldn't be tempted. And I enjoyed my night. And as I went to bed i remember reading on here someone say you will never regret not drinking. So true and has spurred me to actually try again iso or not. And I wanted to post in case that helps anyone today /tonight. Get through one more day. You won't regret it. IWNDWYT
That's fantastic insight and decision making. And also inspiring to me. Thank you.
Same. It's super weird at my in laws if you don't drink. It's hedonistic. I can't believe how normalised it is there.

The regret doesn't help me. I regret a lot but all regret does is make me want to drink to forget a bit! I'm trying to look.forward not back. I'm glad you're enjoying your non drinking self. It made me smile :-)

Thanks for all the up votes and comments. I just had a crap mum moment. my boy got to something he shouldn't as I was careless. He's fine. I saw in time. And I wasn't hungover and I wasn't drunk so didn't have that added guilt. I couldn't cope with the guilt anyway and walked out of the house leaving my boy to my partner. And I sat on a bench. And thought about drinking. And I thought about the gt;500 of you who up voted and I remembered I won't regret not drinking through this moment. And I bought a coke zero instead. Deep breathes. Thank you all.

WRITING.TITLE: Started anti depressants
WRITING.TEXT: For a long time I have wanted to quit drinking. I don't even like drinking any more. It always ramps my anxiety and depression up, even with just one or two drinks. So I've started to try and face some of the root causes. I saw a doctor. I told her everything. And now I'm on mild anti depressants. I can't drink on them anyway. And I feel like this was a big move for me in the right direction. And soon ill start talk therapy too. I don't know if this is appropriate for this sub but I guess I'm sharing as quitting drinking (or trying) for me has helped highlighted there are some deeper issues going on that I need to deal with. Don't be afraid to face those as part of your journey.
Hey. I just posted that I started anti depressants yesterday. I realise I've got to deal with these root feelings that aren't helping the battle to stop numbing myself with booze. So thank you!

WRITING.TEXT: The question says it all really. But I'm on day 3 of 10mg and already feel more motivated and ....... happy! Is this a placebo effect from just doing something positive or could it already be the drugs?

I just started meds 7 days ago and its been a game changer for me. I was scared to for years for PND and my son is nearly 3. One week in and all I can think is God why didn't I do this sooner. WRITING.TITLE: Best decision I've made
WRITING.TEXT: I guess I just want to share that I'm so relieved and happy I finally made the decision to try anti depressants for my PND. I've had underlying tendency to depression throughout my life but always been very well managed with lifestyle and talking therapy if needed. Then had a miscarriage, a pregnancy again 3 months later and birth and I guess it just was the thing that ignited the depression. about 6 months after my son was born I wasn't crying every day or utterly miserable so I thought I was over the depression and was just tired and demotivated and snappy because parenting is hard. My son is nearly 3. Being in isolation and working from home has given me a lot of time to reflect and I noticed how bad my intrusive thoughts were, how bad my sleep was, my constant fatigue, inability to follow through on good choices that I wanted like healthy eating and exercise. So I saw my dr and im on day 10 of prozac and I feel happy. Just actually happy and relaxed. Id forgotten what this was. Im exercising again. I've been able to stop drinking. I'm making better food choices. Concentrating at work. Is it too early to be the prozac? Is it just that ive made a positive decision and its a bit of placebo? I don't know. But I wanted to share this in case it helps anyone else who isn't sure whether to speak to their Dr.
Is it time to speak to your Dr again? Maybe they'd want to increase the dose? It's great youre aware of it and that it helped before so im sure there will be a solution

Its amazing. I feel so bad my son has had such inconsistent mothering from me and I'm just so glad I can be there for him now. Im really happy to hear its working well for you. How long have you been on it may I ask?

Thank you! I'm only on 10mg. I've noted some people say after a few weeks they maybe adjust and feel bad again but I now know what the benchmark should be and that things can help so if that happens im prepared to deal with it.
Ha yes that's what brought me here before I started so I wanted to give people hope!

WRITING.TITLE: Feeling the feelings
WRITING.TEXT: I am a month in now and going strong. I had a job interview today. I think it didn't go great. But that isn't the point of the post. I was nervous. And then I had adrenalin. And excitement. And afterwards i wanted to cry. And some of my roller coaster emotions today were so strong. And it made me think about all the years I've spent numbing emotions through alcohol. Bad emotions. Feeling sad or depressed or bored or angry. Have a drink. Feeling happy and joyous and excited. Have a drink. It always ends the same way though. Hungover- anxious - regretful. As hard as it is to feel emotions sometimes, it is important to feel them and go through it. They pass - even without alcohol they pass. And for every negative emotion you numb with booze you numb positive one's too. I felt really alive today. Goodness me what a ramble. Not sure if it'll make sense to anyone.
If i drink today then tomorrow I will fall short of what my family deserves. I read something similar on here and that is my motivating quote if im ever tempted

I think that's totally normal to feel that way and you know drinking wont fix any of it. Definitely think about seeing someone if you're ready to do so. Being AF you now have space to feel what's going on and properly address it healthily Good luck

WRITING.TITLE: Getting colds and sore throats when autoimmune
WRITING.TEXT: Try and make the history short but I likely have some undiagnosed autoimmune. In 2015 left leg and arm weakness join pain fatigue also a history of vulvodynia and interstitial cystitis. ANA 1:1280 but negative for SLE Sjogren's etc. So concluded non specific connective tissue disorder put on hyroxychlorquine and sent on my way. 2019 new country drs say all blood work normal probably an isolated event. Stop hydroxychloroquine. 2020 sore throat 5 months. Fatigue is back. Mouth ulcers. ANA 1:320. I catch sons cold and now have a proper sore throat. Dr diagnoses strep throat and taking antibiotics 4 days in. Seeing rheumotologist Wednesday. But. I feel like I've been hit by a bus. Im tired I've got constant headaches im struggling to concentrate i feel so ill. Breathless if I walk too far. Nauseous. This isn't just the strep throat. So I guess my question is do normal infections make you feel so much worse if you've an underlying autoimmune condition or should i be seriously worrying about what the hell is wrong with me right now? Ps two negative covid tests

If you are at risk please call safe steps on 1800 015 188. There is a pot of money for those who need to leave because if violence to be accommodated. The police are also aware. Edit: I know you haven't said there is violence but I'm posting this because of the other replies suggesting you can't leave and this is why violence is increasing. Id hate for someone experiencing violence to read this thread and not realise there is help available.

I have some prednisolone left over and hydrox from when the dr took me off it. Is it weird to try and hold off taking until they've done all blood tests Wednesday? I'm so desperate for an actual answer as to what is wrong with me I don't want to take something that may interfere with results.

WRITING.TITLE: Small wins
WRITING.TEXT: I won a very nice bottle of wine a few months back in a wine quiz. We were saving it for a special occasion. Ive since quit the booze. Previously when I've quit, something like that bottle would be the "exception" to my sobriety. And I'd justify having a drink because its special or an occasion or a Saturday. And we know how that goes. Anyway I've decided that I'm giving it to my husband to enjoy on our anniversary next week. I don't feel even remotely tempted to try it. And this feels like a small win to me as it reveals to me how I feel different this time. This time I see this as permanent change to my way of life and no desire to go back to my old ways for any reason. Something has finally clicked for me. So don't worry if this is your 1000th day 1. I had many day 1s too. Keep having them because one day that day 1 will be the one that sticks and youll feel it.

WRITING.TITLE: A few days of struggling
WRITING.TEXT: Ive been doing remarkably well this attempt and this is the longest I have gone without drinking. I thought finally this is it! Then the past 3 days have been cravings from hell. I feel like i have thought about nothing but alcohol non stop. It coincided with stress (stage 4 lockdowns). I even said to my husband on day 3 of craving ive decided to just have a drink. I concluded I'd have one and I'd hate it and not sleep and it would kill the cravings. He told me he thought it was a mistake. So I resisted one more night. And then tonight I realised the cravings had passed. They passed once I accepted my situation for what it is and embrace the lock down positively. So this time I beat that battle. WRITING.TITLE: Welcome to Country
WRITING.TEXT: Hi I hope this is an appropriate place to ask. I want to give an acknowledgement to country when I open a meeting and refer to the traditional lands of the people I live on. When I looked this up the info said the traditional owners have not been identified or agreed. I know I can give an acknowledgement to traditional owners without specifying but I almost feel I want to call out that this hasn't been agreed and its a further highlight of the ongoing impact of colonisation today. But it then feels somewhat inappropriate in an acknowledgement. Can anyone share their views? Thank you Edit: welcome to acknowledgement
Of course. I'm sorry I meant acknowledgement. Thank you I've edited my post but cannot edit the title.
It does thank you. I don't want to labour the point but I also want to be clear that I'm not just saying words without having thought about it. I really appreciate the response.

WRITING.TITLE: Bad dream and now flashbacks
WRITING.TEXT: I had a bad dream last night which, as dreams do, shifted and changed shape. But it all centred around behaviour when drunk. Drunk texting and regretting it. Weird behaviour. Anxiety. Walking home drunk in the dark and lost. Not being able to drive in a crisis because I had had a drink. It was so weird to see that nightmare and all day I've just been haunted by it knowing this used to be my life. My birthdays and weekends and new years and holidays. All wrapped around this weird inebriated state which had a 50-50 chance of being the best or worst night ever. And then today it's caused me flash back memories of some of my most shameful drunk moments. Is this just my brain starting to process things. I've never stopped drinking this long and I'm finding it a bit unsettling!
I wonder if a foodbank would take them? I assume people relying on food banks for support could benefit from not having to find money for masks.
Thats awesome work well done! IWNDWYT
Geez thats awful. I.hope the test results come soon

Inspiring. My goal is to also get my fitness back and get muscle. I used to enjoy being so fit and strong. Im early days in and the weight is just starting to drop now. Ive a way to go but this has inspired me that it keeps getting better. And lol re the tattoo mirror thing

WRITING.TITLE: 10 years ago.....
WRITING.TEXT: I woke to a message from a friend this morning reminding me that 10 years ago I was kicked out of a music festival for weeing in a field. I was too drunk to queue for the toilets. Fast forward 10 years and im 75 days sober and grateful every day I've managed to realise how destructive alcohol is and take positive steps to improve my situation. Sad it took me so long. There are worse stories than this one in my repertoire. But here is to the future. IWNDWYT

Female too. I remember being incensed and rude as I was marched off past men weeing. He said I was indecent whereas men could wee more discreetly..... I ruined that day dont remember the bands had to walk along a country road drunk in a dangerous way. But hey that was then. This is now.
IWNDWYT!
So boring. I go to bed so early now. But im 77 days in and in my second lockdown. I can definitely say lockdown with hangovers is worse. Hang in there. IWNDWYT

I hear you. My husband hasn't been able to drink for a few weeks due to medication. I came downstairs tonight and he had poured a wine. It totally knocked me. I was so tempted and it was unexpected so I hadnt mentally prepared. I had to fight that urge so much. But keep fighting because it IS worth it and it IS better. Waking up tomorrow hangover and anxiety free will be a much better buzz. IWNDWYT

How did you go? Happy waking up hangover free? I sure am. I came down and saw the empty wine bottle from hubby and just felt a wash of sickness then relief when I realised it wasn't me and I wasn't going to have to deal with a hangover all day.

WRITING.TITLE: Thank you to everyone who posts
WRITING.TEXT: Whether you are day 1(take 1000) or day 1000. Or venting. Or sharing your latest drunken regret. Or how you tried moderation and it failed. How you gained a hobby, or a waistline or saved your relationships. Everytime I visit here I find a story like mine or which answers my current questions or eases my doubt or stops me relapsing. Everyone single one of you no matter where you are on this journey by being open to stopping drinking, kind, honest, supportive and non judgemental - you've all created a safe space that is literally keeping people like me (and a person like you) going on. IWNDWYT!

WRITING.TITLE: I'm winning
WRITING.TEXT: Nearly at 100 days sober. The weight hasn't come off miraculously as id like (im sure I was promised to lose 10% of my body weight without even trying.......). Today is the day my stop drinking fitness kicks in!

This morning as I wake up hangover free and hes still in bed after drinking too much im so grateful I managed to resist. I was told by a colleague police attended bunnings in her area fining anyone doing click and collect for non essential items. I guess it is outside the rules i get it. But at the same time it feels heavy handed when it is contactless click and collect very low risk and helps people keep their minds and body active with something positive. I can walk down the shop and into the shop for alcohol as essential but not get gardening stuff for my mental health contactless. There is a line and on this occasion im the wrong side of it i guess

I thought it may be the 5km thing too but I specifically asked if it was non essential and they said yes. I just checked dhhs website and it says "shopping for food or other essential items". Click and collect is for essential items. I thought i read somewhere one summary that click and collect for non essential is in the second or third step.

Oh sorry yes to delivery. I actually did do delivery first time and generally do. But typically i needed some things I didnt realise like clips and more stones. Just wanted to avoid another 100 bucks delivery fees.

Constantly saying to little one we can't see nanna we can't see grandpa we can't go to the zoo etc. My back is killing me but I can't swim for relief as no pool within my 5km. I just feel limited hope. I think you have one chance maybe two to get down to 0. Like NZ or the other states. You go hard and early. It is not sustainable to keep everyone in limbo for months to get to 0 when it's obvious it can be lost in a heartbeat. Im not anti lockdown. For sure keep lots of rules in place. But it needs easing to a more sustainable level economically and for mental health whilst keeping infections and death as low as possible. I also think it doesn't take into account that we've learned a lot now about tracing and about treatment which we didn't know back in March. Just a whinge. Big sighs.

Yes! Thank you this helped. Just copy pasting for anyone else that may be curious. If you test positive for coronavirus (COVID-19) you must isolate until you receive clearance from the Department of Health and Human Services. If you have been identified as a close contact you must quarantine for 14 days since your last contact with a positive case. A fine of $4,957 can be issued to a person found to have breached the requirement to isolate or quarantine for a second or subsequent time. #8239; Victoria Police can issue on the spot fines of #8239;up to $1,652 #8239;for individuals and #8239;up to $9,913 #8239;for businesses for: Refusing or failing to comply with the emergency directions Refusing or failing to comply with a public health risk power direction Refusing or failing to comply with the Public Health Directions to provide information. Fines of up to $20,000 for individuals and $100,000 for businesses are possible through the court system. Individuals who do not wear a face mask and do not have a lawful reason can be fined $200.

WRITING.TITLE: The gluten challenge
WRITING.TEXT: Hey all I was originally told stop eating gluten as you may be celiac (have the gene and some unexplained autoimmune things). I did. Then gastro issues continued so new dr says eat gluten 4 weeks as if we are doing gastroscopy anyway want to rule celiac in or out. Well let's say resuming gluten has been hell. Way worse than when I gave it up. Ive heard the biopsy isn't always 100%. And I've read different things on how much gluten I should be eating these 4 weeks. My dr said 2 bits of toast a day. So I already am miserable. I dont want to be miserable and inconclusive because I didn't eat enough gluten. Does anyone have any knowledge of current research to support how much gluten is enough gluten or is it really variable? Or does anyone have any info about % of false negatives on biopsy? Thanks. I guess I'm just wanting to make sure these 4 weeks of D amp;V give me the answers!!
